title: Who is the real Beatles legend, John Lennon or Paul McCartney? - Quora

response.answer_text: I see it's been answered. Both of them were not only legendary but the music and the Beatles are immortal. Actually all four of them are legendary, all four of them John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison and Richard (call me Ringo Starr) Starkey legends in their own time. Also stop trying to pit John and Paul against one another it's tiresome.  The Beatles George Harrison, Ringo Starr, Paul McCartney and John Lennon  John Lennon and Paul McCartney throughout the years.

In terms of songwriting, both. In terms of the Beatles, all 4. The key word here is synergy. The whole was greater than the sum of the parts. Of course some fans prefer Lennon and others prefer McCartney, but that’s subjective and does not negate the contributions of the other. Also, because Lennon is deceased, he tends to get a bit more recognition as a legendary figure. That almost always happens when an artist dies. If one wants to break it down, McCartney was stronger as a melodist and musically in general. Lennon was stronger lyrically and pushed lyrical boundaries. But they complimented each other perfectly and spurred each other into a healthy competition, so McCartney was quite an excellent lyricist at times and John at times was an excellent melodist. John was a bit more of the rebel, rock and roll type, Paul was a bit more of the diplomatic and versatile type. So neither was the key member. They were equally important in different ways.
